ctpMetaData.bhstData:
Delhi NCR has 500+ top MBA colleges. Out of these, 357 colleges are privately owned, 36 colleges are owned by public/government organisations, and public-private entities own 2 MBA colleges. CAT, MAT, CMAT, XAT, ATMA, and NMAT are some of the most accepting entrance exams in top MBA colleges in Delhi NCR. JMI, IIM Rohtak, MDI, Amity University Noida, IIFT Delhi, IMT Ghaziabad, etc. are some of the popular MBA colleges in Delhi NCR.

The revised position for some of the premier MBA institutions in Delhi/NCR is mentioned below:

  • IIT Delhi declined its ranking as it shifted to rank 5 in 2023 as compared to rank 4 in 2022.
  • IIM Rohtak improved its ranking as it shifted to rank 12 in 2023 as compared to rank 16 in 2022.

Latest Updates:

  • TheÂ XAT 2024 registration last dateÂ has beenÂ extended tillÂ Dec 10, 2023.Â Further, XAT 2024 admit card will be released onÂ Dec 20, 2023Â and the exam is scheduled forÂ Jan 7, 2024.Â 
  • CAT exam 2023Â was held on November 26, 2023. Registered candidates can download the official answer key from theÂ IIMCAT website.
  • KMAT 2023 result is likely to be announced in the month of December 2023. Candidates who appeared for theÂ KMAT Karnataka exam 2023Â can check their results online.

Best MBA Colleges in Delhi NCR: Highlights 2023

Master of Business Administration (MBA) is one of the sought-after courses to pursue anywhere across the globe. MBA graduates are in high demand irrespective of their stream or specialisation. The degree is typically imparted in a duration of two years. However, some B-schools offer a PG Diploma in Management that can be completed within one year. Candidates holding a bachelorâs degree are eligible to apply for MBA admission. Besides a bachelorâs degree, top MBA colleges in Delhi/NCR also require suitable work experience.

Check out the highlights below of the MBA colleges in Delhi NCR:

Particulars

Parameters

No. of Colleges

How can I get admission to top MBA colleges in Delhi NCR?

The eligibility criteria for MBA courses may vary across institutes offering the same. However, the basic eligibility criteria prescribed by theÂ Universities Grants CommissionÂ for MBA is is as follows:

  • Candidates passing a bachelorâs level examination irrespective of the discipline from a recognised institute are eligible to pursue an MBA degree course.
  • An institute might follow minimum aggregate score criteria of 50 percent in the qualifying exam for unreserved category candidates and 45 percent aggregate for reserved category candidates.
  • Final-year candidates are also eligible to apply for an MBA subject to meeting the above-mentioned eligibility conditions.

What are the entrance exams for MBA colleges in Delhi NCR?

The two most popular entrance exams accepted in MBA Colleges in Delhi/NCR are:

  • XAT:Â XATÂ (Xavier Aptitude Test) is a national-level management entrance examination conducted byÂ XLRI, JamshedpurÂ for admission to MBA/PGDM programmes.Â XAT preparationÂ needs at least six to nine months. Being one of the tougherÂ MBA entrance examsÂ among its peers, XAT requires dedicated time and effort. It comprises four sections: Decision Making,Â Verbal AbilityÂ andÂ Logical Reasoning,Â Quantitative AbilityÂ &Â Data InterpretationÂ and General Knowledge.
  • CAT:Â Common Admission Test (CAT) is a national-level management aptitude test for admission to the MBAÂ courses offered by 20 IIMs and over 1,200 B-schools in India.Â CAT question paperÂ is divided into three sections: Verbal Ability and Reading Comprehension, Data Interpretation and Logical Reasoning and Quantitative Aptitude. TheÂ preparation for CAT exam should include phase wiseÂ completion of the CAT syllabus, mock test practice, and revision.
  • MAT:Â Management Aptitude Test or MATÂ is a national-level entrance exam conducted by theÂ All India Management Association (AIMA) for admissions to MBA/PGDM courses. The exam is conducted in multiple sessions in four phases â February, May, September, and December.Â MAT examÂ is conducted in offline (Paper Based Test or PBT), online (Computer Based Test or CBT) and remote proctored (Internet Based Test or IBT) modes.

mainEntity.name: How many MBA colleges are there in Delhi NCR?

acceptedAnswer.text: In Delhi NCR, there are 517 excellent XAT, colleges overall. Out of them, 357 colleges are privately held, 36 are owned by public or government agencies, and 2 MBA colleges are owned through public-private partnerships. Some of the entrance tests that are most accepted at the best MBA colleges in Delhi NCR include XAT, MAT, CMAT, XAT, ATMA, and NMAT. Some of the well-known MBA institutes in Delhi NCR include JMI, IIM Rohtak, MDI, Amity University Noida, IIFT Delhi, and IMT Ghaziabad.

mainEntity.name: What is MBA fees in Delhi/NCR?

acceptedAnswer.text: IIM Rohtak has the the highest total tuition fee ranging from INR 18 lakh - INR 34 lakh, while JMI Delhi has the the lowest total tuition ranging from INR 39,000 - INR 3 lakh. The top MBA schools in Delhi-NCR are included in the table below, along with their total tuition costs: College Name Total Tuition Fees MDI Gurgaon Admission INR 18 lakh - INR 25 lakh Amity University Noida Admission INR 5 lakh - INR 19 lakh IMI Delhi Admission INR 21 lakh IMT Ghaziabad Admission INR 19 lakh IIT Delhi Admission INR 11 lakh IIM Rohtak Admission INR 18 lakh - INR 34 lakh IIFT Delhi Admission INR 22 lakh JMI Delhi Admission INR 39,000 - INR 3 lakh

mainEntity.name: Can I do MBA without giving any entrance exam?

acceptedAnswer.text: In rare circumstances, it is possible to pursue an MBA without taking any entrance exam. The CAT, MAT, GMAT, XAT, and other standardized entrance exams are required for admission to many MBA programs worldwide. If you are not planning to take the CAT in 2023, listed below are some direct admission eligibility criteria to help you be accepted into MBA programs. The minimum score required in the UG level examination may differ from one college to another, however, the student must have scored at least 50%-65% aggregate in his or her graduation. For the reserved category, the score should at least be 45% aggregate. Some institutes accept other competitive exam scores such as XAT, MAT, GMAT, NMAT, ATMA, SNAP, etc. READ MORE: Best MBA Colleges without CAT Exam If you did not appear for the CAT exam and still wish to get admission to the best MBA colleges in India without CAT, then, here is a list of top MBA institutes that give admissions based on different entrance criteria or exams. MBA Colleges/ Institutes MBA Exam Score Accepted SIBM, Pune SNAP XLRI, Jamshedpur XAT Xavier University, Bhubaneshwar XAT, X-GMT Indian School of Business, Hyderabad GMAT Amity University XAT/GMAT/MAT/CAT/NMAT

mainEntity.name: What is the placement package offered to MBA graduates at the top MBA colleges in the Delhi NCR?

acceptedAnswer.text: MDI Gurgaon and IIT Delhi offered the highest placement ranging from INR 25 LPA - INR 27 LPA. Prominent recruiters participated include Asian Paints, KPMG, Infoedge, Google, HCL, Godrej, etc., while JMI Delhi offered the lowest placement of INR 8 LPA and the prominent recruiters include Amazon, Accenture, Samsung R&D, etc. Listed below are the top MBA colleges in Delhi NCR along with their placement package and prominent recruiters: College Name Placement Package Top Recruiters MDI Gurgaon Placements INR 25 LPA - INR 27 LPA Asian Paints, KPMG, Infoedge, Google, HCL, Godrej, etc. IIM Rohtak Placements INR 18 LPA Amul, Barclays, ICICI Bank, GAIL, EXL Service, Capgemini, Schindler Group, etc. IIT Delhi Placements INR 24 LPA Texas Instruments, Wipro, ICICI, Accenture, Optum, etc. JMI Delhi Placements INR 8 LPA Amazon, Accenture, Samsung R&D, etc. Also Read: Top 5 MBA Specialisations in India 14 MBA specialisations you should definitely know about

mainEntity.name: What are the various entrance exams accepted in top MBA colleges in Delhi NCR?

acceptedAnswer.text: The most well-liked tests that Delhi MBA colleges allow include the CAT, MAT, XAT, CMAT, GMAT, ATMA, etc.For a whole list of tests that Delhi/NCR MBA colleges accept, see the table below: Exams Number of Colleges Cut off 2023 Predictor CAT 224 CAT 2023 Predictor MAT 197 MAT 2023 Predictor CMAT 154 CMAT 2023 Predictor XAT 147 XAT 2023 Predictor ATMA 60 ATMA 2023 Predictor Preparing for CAT 2023? Click to practice: Q&A for Verbal Ability Q&A for Quantitative Aptitude Q&A for Data Interpretation and Logical Reasoning Read More About CAT, MAT, and CMAT Mock Test Series: Download CAT Previous Years Question Papers Free Online CAT Mock Test Series Free Online CMAT Mock Test Series Free Online MAT Mock Test Series

mainEntity.name: What is the eligibility criteria to get admission in top MBA colleges in Delhi NCR?

acceptedAnswer.text: Different institutions providing the same MBA programs may have different requirements for admission. However, the Universities Grants Commission has established the following basic qualifying requirements for MBA programs: Candidates completing a bachelor's level test from a recognised institution, in any discipline, are qualified to enroll in an MBA degree program. For candidates in the unreserved category, an institute may require a qualifying exam aggregate score of 50 percent, and for those in the reserved category, a qualifying exam aggregate score of 45 percent. Candidates in their final year may also apply for an MBA programme as long as they complete the prerequisite requirements listed above.

mainEntity.name: What are the specialisations offered in top MBA colleges in Delhi NCR?

acceptedAnswer.text: MBA programmes in Delhi NCR are available with a variety of specialisations, including those in Sales and Marketing, Finance, Human Resources, IT and Systems, Operations, Retail, Healthcare, International Business, Business Analytics, Supply Chain, Transport & Logistics, IB, Travel & Tourism, Agriculture & Food Business, Pharmaceuticals, Project Management, Public Policy, Rural Management, and Data Science. Get a full breakdown of the top MBA specializations available in Delhi/NCR by looking at the table below: Top Specialisations Number of Colleges Finance 216 Sales & Marketing 210 International Resources 203 International Business 150 IT & Systems 132

mainEntity.name: When should I start preparing for MBA entrance exam?

acceptedAnswer.text: In the final year of graduation, preparation for an MBA begins. The majority of management aspirants begin their preparation as soon as they begin their third year of their bachelor's degree programme because it takes months to properly prepare for MBA entrance exams. However, there are a lot of challenges in preparing for an MBA entrance exam, including the lengthy syllabus, the difficulty of the questions, and the degree of competition. Here are some suggestions to help you study for your MBA entrance exams: Study the fundamental grammatical and writing principles for the verbal segment to become familiar with the language's structure. To hone their quantitative abilities, students should complete a lot of practice exams and sample papers. Create a schedule and follow it Students should not overstress themselves and should get enough rest.

mainEntity.name: What job profiles are available to students after completing an MBA degree?

acceptedAnswer.text: The top MBA specialisations that typically result in the highest salaries after graduation are finance, marketing, general management, business analytics, and entrepreneurship. Following an MBA, the highest-paying jobs in India range in salary from INR 5 to 30 LPA. Following are some of the well-liked post-MBA career possibilities and their associated salaries: MBA job profiles Average salary (INR) Finance Manager 9.6 LPA Marketing Manager 10 LPA Sales Manager 10 LPA Human Resources Manager 4 LPA Operations Manager 7 LPA Product Manager 15 LPA Data Analytics Manager 14 LPA Digital Marketing Manager 4.5 LPA NGO Manager 5 LPA Also Read: List of MBA Specialisations: Which one to Choose?

ctp_tuple_6.questionText: When should I start preparing for MBA entrance exam?
ctp_tuple_6.answerText:
In the final year of graduation, preparation for an MBA begins. The majority of management aspirants begin their preparation as soon as they begin their third year of their bachelor's degree programme because it takes months to properly prepare for MBA entrance exams. However, there are a lot of challenges in preparing for an MBA entrance exam, including the lengthy syllabus, the difficulty of the questions, and the degree of competition. 

Here are some suggestions to help you study for your MBA entrance exams:

  • Study the fundamental grammatical and writing principles for the verbal segment to become familiar with the language's structure.
  • To hone their quantitative abilities, students should complete a lot of practice exams and sample papers.
    Create a schedule and follow it
  • Students should not overstress themselves and should get enough rest.

ctp_tuple_4.questionText: What is the eligibility criteria to get admission in top MBA colleges in Delhi NCR?
ctp_tuple_4.answerText:
Different institutions providing the same MBA programs may have different requirements for admission. However, the Universities Grants Commission has established the following basic qualifying requirements for MBA programs:

  • Candidates completing a bachelor's level test from a recognised institution, in any discipline, are qualified to enroll in an MBA degree program.
  • For candidates in the unreserved category, an institute may require a qualifying exam aggregate score of 50 percent, and for those in the reserved category, a qualifying exam aggregate score of 45 percent.
  • Candidates in their final year may also apply for an MBA programme as long as they complete the prerequisite requirements listed above.

ctp_tuple_3.questionText: How many MBA colleges are there in Delhi NCR?
ctp_tuple_3.answerText: In Delhi NCR, there are 517 excellent XAT, colleges overall. Out of them, 357 colleges are privately held, 36 are owned by public or government agencies, and 2 MBA colleges are owned through public-private partnerships. Some of the entrance tests that are most accepted at the best MBA colleges in Delhi NCR include XAT, MAT, CMAT, XAT, ATMA, and NMAT. Some of the well-known MBA institutes in Delhi NCR include JMI, IIM Rohtak, MDI, Amity University Noida, IIFT Delhi, and IMT Ghaziabad.

ctp_tuple_3.questionText: What is MBA fees in Delhi/NCR?
ctp_tuple_3.answerText:
IIM Rohtak has the the highest total tuition fee ranging from INR 18 lakh - INR 34 lakh, while JMI Delhi has the the lowest total tuition ranging from INR 39,000 - INR 3 lakh.

ctp_tuple_3.questionText: Can I do MBA without giving any entrance exam?
ctp_tuple_3.answerText:
In rare circumstances, it is possible to pursue an MBA without taking any entrance exam. The CAT, MAT, GMAT, XAT, and other standardized entrance exams are required for admission to many MBA programs worldwide. 

If you are not planning to take the CAT in 2023, listed below are some direct admission eligibility criteria to help you be accepted into MBA programs.

  • The minimum score required in the UG level examination may differ from one college to another, however, the student must have scored at least 50%-65% aggregate in his or her graduation.
  • For the reserved category, the score should at least be 45% aggregate.
  • Some institutes accept other competitive exam scores such as XAT, MAT, GMAT, NMAT, ATMA, SNAP, etc.

READ MORE: Best MBA Colleges without CAT Exam
